title: What is the recipe for success?
text:
BAFTA award winning show The Great British Bake Off has had different hosts and judges throughout the years, but it has remained a fan favorite since 2010. This project uses data from the bakeoff package in R to examine competitors across 10 series. Their age, challenge scores, and the descriptions of their entries have been graphed to see how each affects their overall results.
As it turns out, people who scored higher in the “Technical Challenge” round made it farther overall!






Note: Series 1 had 6 episodes and Series 2 had 8, compared to the 10 from that point forward

title: Sources
text: All data used in this project was provided by bakeoff

title: About
text:
About This Project
Github Repo | link
This project was created for Kane’s Free Data Science Bootcamp, a 4-week course that teaches you the basics of data science visualization (everything in this website I learned through it!).
I was inspired, of course, by my all time favorite comfort show, and this dataset: bakeoff

title: Age?
text:
With age, you can see it going both ways: younger people might know more new techniques, but older people may have had more experience and seen a wider variety of recipes.





While the graph shows a slight decrease in episodes appeared as age increases, there are also fewer people above the age of 50 in the competition.

title: Description Length?
text: Descriptions are provided by the baker. Could a shorter description mean they haven’t thought it through or it’s not complicated enough? Could longer descriptions be more complicated and leave more room for error?

title: Description Length?
text:
Description Lengths
Descriptions are provided by the baker. Could a shorter description mean they haven’t thought it through or it’s not complicated enough? Could longer descriptions be more complicated and leave more room for error?

Signature Challenges







Showstopper Challenges

title: Crash Course
text: Twelve amateur bakers from around Great Britain compete in three sets of themed challenges per episode. After each episode, one baker is eliminated and one is crowned “Star Baker.” When it gets down to the final three, whoever gets Star Baker is the winner of that year’s competition.

title: Crash Course
text:
Challenges
The three challenges are:

“Signature”: bakers are given prompt, time limit, and requirements ahead of time
“Technical”: the judges choose a dish that all bakers must attempt to recreate with a pared down recipe. Bakers are scored from 1 (first) to however many bakers remain in the competition.
“Showstopper”: basically the same as the Signature, just at a bigger, more complicated scale

title: More Graphs!
text: The first thing that comes to mind when you think “baking show” is cake, but how much of it is there on GBBO?
